author: milos88
content:
I would say that we should always return as many headers as we have (up to 255) but no more than what was requested.
So for your questions:
- I wouldn't return ENRs
- I would return only 10 headers
- the `ancestor_count` is `uint8`, so client can't request more than 255

author: milos88
content:
But I also have related questions.
- Do ephemeral headers include transactions as well?
- How do we handle BlockBodies and Receipts for ephemeral headers? I assume they are also not gossiped, but can they be retrieved via FINTCONTENT?

author: kolbyml
content: Emphermal headers are just headers, they don’t include transactions or receipts

author: kolbyml
content: Bodies and receipts should be gossiped

author: kolbyml
content: Bodies and receipts will be stored in the ephemeral table if they are not finalized so the latest 64 bodies and receipts, as if a re-org happens we would need to delete them

author: kolbyml
content: Other then that bodies and receipts shouldn’t be handled any differently
